data.title: Supplier Information
data.meta_description: Find supplier information, tools, and resources needed to collaborate with Flex around eCommerce, electronic data, and e-sourcing solutions.
data.text:
Serving our customers around the world

More than ever, it is important to have a trusted, resilient global supply chain network. In a rapidly changing environment, resiliency is essential for bringing products to life – and to our customers around the world.

We know we could not do all the things we do to design and manufacture products without your trust, collaboration and commitment. You help us source the components needed to bring innovative products to market and respond to our customers’ regional and global needs.

Together, we will continue to capture new opportunities and create products that improve the world.

We strive to make working with Flex as simple and valuable as possible for our suppliers. Because the better we collaborate, the more effectively we can serve our mutual customers. Find the tools and resources you need and learn more about our solutions.

ecommerce business solutions

Flex is committed to increasing our customers’ competitiveness by building faster and more cost-efficient supply chains. To this end, we’ve launched a global initiative aimed at increasing supply chain visibility and collaboration with all of our partners by offering ecommerce, electronic data, and e-sourcing solutions.

Explore our ecommerce offerings

aQuire: global procurement, supply chain, and quality assurance

We use state-of-the-art sourcing tools in collaboration with Ivalua for both direct and indirect material sourcing.

Explore aQuire

E-sourcing

E-sourcing uses Flex e-Auction software to provide an online collaborative forum for Flex and our suppliers. Our Global Commodity Management team uses this tool for the selection of the most competitive prices through electronic auctions.

E-sourcing facilitates both indirect and direct materials purchases and offers many advantages and opportunities for the current supply base, as well as opportunities for competitive companies to become suppliers to Flex.

Message to suppliers: COVID-19

Our COVID-19 response focuses on keeping people safe — including our employees, suppliers and business partners. With all safety measures in place in accordance with governments around the world, we are continuing to manufacture as permitted. Please reach out to your Flex contact for more information.

We are especially proud that we are manufacturing critical products to aid the global response. Working together, we are delivering remarkable results in these challenging times.

Thank you for your continued collaboration to keep everyone healthy.

Strengthening supply chain and community through supplier diversity

At Flex, we identify and enable minority-owned suppliers to qualify and successfully compete for our business based on merit. These relationships result in suppliers participating further in the economic mainstream, which ensures a stronger supplier base for the future.

Operating in thriving communities allows us to compete on a global scale. By helping local minority suppliers enter the economic mainstream, we improve the economic stability and vitality of those communities.

The following actions should take place:

Identify, assist, and develop minority suppliers to become qualified suppliers to Flex.

Encourage purchases from minority suppliers, particularly in communities where we have a presence.

Conduct formal and timely reviews of progress against our own minority procurement goals.

Criteria, requirements, and guidelines to be considered a Flex diverse supplier

A business that is at least 51% owned by, and whose management and daily business operations are controlled by, one or more members of a socially and economically disadvantaged minority group or that falls into the following business categories.

Minority-Owned

African-Americans (Black)

Hispanic Americans

Asian-Pacific American

Native Americans

Indian Sub-Continent Americans

Minority Business Enterprise (MBE)

Women-Owned

The supplier must be certified, maintained and updated as one of the diverse classifications mentioned above.

Some of the organizations that can provide these certifications are:

National Minority Supplier Development Council (NMSDC)

Women’s Business Enterprise National Council (WBENC)

Canadian Aboriginal and Minority Supplier Council (CAMSC)

National Women Business Owners Corp. (NWBOC)

Women Business Enterprises of Canada (WBE Canada)

National Veteran Business Development Council (NVBDC)

WE Connect international

APACC – Asian Pacific American Chamber of Commerce

GLWBE – Great Lakes Women’s Business Council

MHCC – Michigan Hispanic Chamber of Commerce

MMSDC – Michigan Minority Supplier Development Council

VOBRT – Veteran Owned Business Round Table

Attributes we look for in our suppliers:

Excellence in quality systems

Cost competitiveness

Continuous improvement initiatives

On-time delivery

Proper and up-to-date certifications for production suppliers

Financial stability

Capacity for growth

Ethics and integrity in business

Compliance with Flex contractual terms and conditions
